reviews.review_title: Good option for a visit to La Rochelle
reviews.positive_text:
The hotel was a 15 minute walk to the Old Town and port area - which was lovely and very nice to walk around. There are many shops, restaurants and bars available in the Old Town.

The breakfast buffet was good with warm options (e.g. eggs, bacon, pancakes), small selection of cheese & cold meats, and a variety of breads and baked goods. The double bed was comfortable and definitely large enough for two people. The room was very clean.

The hotel offered safe, if a bit pricey, parking.
reviews.negative_text:
Our double room was rather small for a several day stay. 

The construction in the area around the hotel was unbelievably bad - constant road closures which google maps was not always registering. With the one-way streets, it was not easy finding the hotel. We did an excursion one day and it took us 10 minutes to just get out of the immediate area with the backed up traffic. 

The area immediately around the hotel did not offer anything - you really had to go into the Old Town for restaurant or shopping options.

reviews.positive_text: Staff were nice, parking secure, short walk to city centre
reviews.negative_text: Shower was tiny and leaked water over the floor

reviews.positive_text: A very comfortable hotel with a good continental breakfast. No proper kitchen facilities for an evening meal, but they offered a brief selection of "ping" cooked meals if you were desperate!
reviews.negative_text: Appeared this hotel is run for the staffs benefit and not the patrons. Example during the Euro 2024 matches, the lounge tv was turned off at 10 pm just when the second half got under way.. You had to go up to your bedroom to watch the rest of the match or go to a bar in town. One got the feeling the staff were poorly paid as there appeared to be only one on duty at anyone time - doing check-ins, pouring drinks, going into the kitchen to ping your meal, etc.  The hotel was 1 mile out from the port attractions - about 20 minutes walk if you were fit enough. Staff were not well briefed on where to catch a 'bus or where in the town you would find a taxi rank or office.

reviews.review_title: Convenient location to our cycle route and La Rochelle Old Port!

reviews.review_title:
Modern room/bathroom , kitchen 



but other issues encountered
reviews.positive_text: The hotel is modern inside, it was also very clean. There was a kettle and some coffee sticks/sugar & a biscuit to use.
reviews.negative_text: I contacted the hotel in advance to advise we would be arriving around 11pm (the reception closes at 9 I believe) and my understanding was that someone would wait for us. Unfortunately, we got there just after 11, the gate was shut, no obvious way to get to the main entrance. Phoned the entry phone but the gate (which had a note it was to use for emergencies only, in French) and was told the hotel was closed. Only after I explained I let the hotel know of the late arrival, my name was checked and the entry code was provided. It was a little odd that my room was left wide open. Also, the Internet did not work (it did not recognize my name, which was needed to access the WiFi); this was only sorted in the morning, just before we checked out.We got rubbish bins right outside of our window, so not too cool. Despite of the hotel being quite modern, I think it is overpriced.

reviews.review_title: Another great stay in La Rochelle
reviews.positive_text: The front desk person, Pica,  upon arrival was very helpful and informative.   Initially, we were disappointed that there is no restaurant next door (there was when we stayed here a number of years ago), but it all worked out nicely because we were able to order dinner at the hotel.  The front desk ordered our dinner from a local catering company and it was all very delicious.  We enjoyed it so much that we did the same thing the next evening.  Breakfast was also very good as were the breakfast staff.  The location of the hotel was along the river pathway and it was an easy 15 minute walk to the harbour.  Rooms very clean, nicely decorated and comfortable.
Location short walk into centre, parking is good for a small charge, Hotels had a makeover since I last stayed here, very well done. I would recommend this hotel.

Position to town centre 15 mins walk. Ease of finding hotel. Modern, light and tasteful decor. On street free parking. Ample paid on site secure parking. Light and spacious reception/lounge area. 
Excellent bedroom size & facilities. Good breakfast offering hot and cold options. Very competitive pricing on accommodation websites. 

Staff friendly and efficient. Polite and helpful. Excellent service from all members.
reviews.negative_text:
There is nothing to dislike!
I spent many years in the hotel business and I can find no criticism with our stay. 1 night 3 guests in 3 separate bedrooms. All excellent value for money.

reviews.positive_text: Great updated spot. Prices very reasonable at the time we stayed. Hotel staff was A++. Our dogs were welcome, bed & linens were super comfortable, parking was easy. We walked everywhere we wanted to go. We‚Äôd absolutely stay again.

reviews.negative_text: We paid for secure parking which was only secured at one end. The "exit" was unsecured. also there were bike racks but they were round the back of the property without security TV coverage and next to the unsecured exit !!

reviews.review_title: great stay way better than the expectation.

There's a water kettle as well!
